raw_text:
Duff ruled out of Barcelona clash
 
 Chelsea's Damien Duff has been ruled out of Wednesday's Champions League clash with Barcelona at the Nou Camp.
 
 Duff sustained a knee injury in the FA Cup defeat at Newcastle and manager Jose Mourinho said: "He cannot run. His injury is very painful, so he is out." But Mourinho has revealed defender Willian Gallas and striker Didier Drogba will be in the starting line-up. The Blues boss took the unusual step of naming his side a day before the match, with Jole Cole named in midfield. Mourinho said: "We have one more session but I think Drogba will play, and Gallas will play. "Drogba trained on Monday with no problems and will do the same on Tuesday. Gallas feels he can play and wants to play. We are protecting him still but he will be okay to play." Drogba, Chelsea's £24m striker, has missed the last three weeks through injury.
 
 Cech, Ferreira, Carvalho, Terry, Gallas, Tiago, Makelele, Lampard, Cole, Drogba, Gudjohnsen.
llama3.2:1b: Chelsea's Damien Duff is ruled out of Wednesday's Champions League match against Barcelona due to a knee injury sustained in the FA Cup defeat at Newcastle.
The injured player will not participate in the game and has been replaced by Willian Gallas and Didier Drogba, who trained on Monday without issues.
llama3.2:3b: Damien Duff will not play in Wednesday's Champions League match against Barcelona due to a knee injury, while Didier Drogba and Willian Gallas are expected to start alongside Jole Cole.
gemma2:2b: Damien Duff is out of the Barcelona match due to a knee injury.
Jose Mourinho named his starting line-up for Wednesday's game a day in advance and included Willian Gallas and Didier Drogba in the lineup.

Duff sustained a knee injury in the FA Cup defeat and will be replaced by Willian Gallas and Didier Drogba.
Chelsea will name Jole Cole, defender Cech, Ferreira, Carvalho, Terry, Galla, Makelele, Lampard, Cole, Drogba, Gudjohnsen among their starting XI.

Chelsea manager Jose Mourinho confirmed Drogba will play despite previous injury problems.
qwen2.5:3b: Duff ruled out of Chelsea vs Barcelona match due to a knee injury.
Mourinho named his starting lineup a day early with Joleon Cole in midfield.
Willian Gallas and Didier Drogba are set to play despite initial concerns about their fitness.
Drogba missed the last three weeks, while Gallas is expected to recover from minor issues.
The starting XI includes Petr Cech, Luiz Felipe de Souza, Ricardo Carvalho, John Terry, Gallas, Tiago, Michael Ballack, Ashley Cole, Drogba, and Eidur Gudjohnsen.

tinyllama:1.1b: Out of the FA Cup match against Newcastle at the Nou Camp on February 3rd, Damien Duff's knee injury has ruled him out for Barcelona's upcoming Champions League clash.
Coach José Mourinho named Willian Gallas and Dani Alves as starters ahead of the match, with Didier Drobgaba and László Fülöp also included in the starting lineup.
Duff had been on crutches since last week due to his injury but will not be available for the game.
Coach Mourinho stated that Duff would undergo a rehabilitation process and will be allowed to play after the match.
The Blues' squad named on Tuesday featured midfielder Joel Cole as an extra player, with no further updates provided regarding their fitness levels.
tinydolphin:1.1b: Based on the text provided, it appears that Duff has been ruled out of the upcoming Champions League clash with Barcelona for a knee injury sustained in the FA Cup match at Newcastle.
Manager Jose Mourinho has named Willian Gallas and striker Didier Drogba as probable starters.
The team will have one more training session before the game, with the coaches protecting the injured players and deciding who can play based on their condition.

Manager Jose Mourinho confirmed Duff's absence but announced that defender William Gallas and striker Didier Drogba will start.
Mourinho unusually named his starting lineup a day early, with Joe Cole in midfield.
Drogba, who has been out for three weeks, trained without issues and is expected to play, while Gallas is also fit despite precautions.
The confirmed lineup includes Cech, Ferreira, Carvalho, Terry, Gallas, Tiago, Makelele, Lampard, Cole, Drogba, and Gudjohnsen.

granite3.1-dense:2b: Chelsea's Damien Duff has been ruled out of Wednesday's Champions League match against Barcelona due to a knee injury sustained in the FA Cup game at Newcastle.
Manager Jose Mourinho confirmed this, stating that Duff can't run and his pain is severe.
However, Mourinho revealed that Willian Gallas and Didier Drogba will start, with Gallas expressing readiness to play.
Drogba, who has been injured for the past three weeks, trained normally on Monday and is expected to participate in Tuesday's session without issues.
The lineup for Chelsea includes Petr Cech, Ashley Cole, John Terry, William Gallas, Frank Lampard, Joe Cole, Drogba, Stéphane Gregoire-Mignot (Gudjohnsen), and Mikel Joseph.
